specs.title: Services: Posts / main index
specs.description: Main posts index. Use the options on this container to define the appearance and functionality of this service.

specs.title: Display style
specs.description:
Select the display style of the posts index:
  • Simple cards wall: Only text, dividing details in sections.
  • "Modern" style cards: Shows the title in white with a dark shadow inside the featured image on each post.
  • Facebook style cards: Divided in three sections: Author details and publishing date on the header, Title, featured image and excerpt on another section and an extra section with additional details (comments, etc.)
  • Reddit style cards: Quick view index with thumbnails (no excerpts). Doesn't include comments, only the total.

specs.title: Permitted levels for inclusion
specs.description: If you want this service to show contents only to users with certain levels, specify them here separated by commas. If empty, everyone (registered or not) will show this index.

specs.title: Posts per screen
specs.description:
Specify the amount of posts to download per screen.
Default value: 10.

specs.title: Include comments
specs.description:
Enable this switch to include comments on the index.
Note: This option will be ignored if the comments system is disabled or overriden by a module with an external source, like the Facebook Comments module.

specs.title: Categories to include
specs.description: List of category slugs to show on this index. If empty, all of them will be included.

specs.title: Excluded categories
specs.description: List of category slugs that will be excluded from this index.

specs.title: Limit to these tags
specs.description: If you want to show posts that have certain hashtags, specify them here, one per line. The posts that have at least one of the tags on this list will be included.

specs.title: Exclude posts with these tags
specs.description: If you want to exclude posts with certain hashtags, specify them here, one per line. The posts that have at least one of the tags on this list will be excluded.

specs.title: Limit to these author levels
specs.description: If you want to show posts of only certain author levels, specify them here, separated by commas.

specs.title: Exclude the next author levels
specs.description: If you want to exclude posts from certain author levels, specify them here, separated by commas.

specs.title: Automatic reload
specs.description:
Select the automatic reload interval for the channel.
Note: Select an interval higher than the posts caching parameters you specified for the posts module to avoid unnecessary calls to the database.

specs.title: Show authors
specs.description: If your website is multi-author and you want the indexes and single posts to display the author credits, enable this option.

specs.title: Hide category selector?
specs.description: By default, a category selector will be shown if there's more than one category on the list. You can disable it with this switch.

specs.title: Hide search?
specs.description: By default, a search control will be shown on the navbar. You can disable it with this switch.

specs.title: Hide quick post floating action button?
specs.description: By default, an action button to add a quick post is added at the bottom of the registered users viewport. Use this switch to disable it.

specs.title: User levels allowed to see the quick post action button
specs.description: Specify a list of comma-separated user levels that will see the quick post floating action button.

specs.title: Color theme
specs.description: Select a color theme to show the service index and contents.

specs.title: Standard service icon
specs.description:
The mobile platform uses different icons for iOS and Android. For iOS, it uses the Framework7 set and for Android it uses Font Awesome. Here you must specify both sepparated by a comma, E.G.:

home,fa-home

Important: Make sure to specify the correct icon keyname for both cases, or your website may receive bad reviews because of the lack of homogeneity between platforms.
  • See the Framework7 icons reference
  • See the Font Awesome reference
If you want to use an image, leave this value empty and use the selector below.

specs.title: Graphical service icon
specs.description:
You can use an image instead of an standard icon for the service using this selector.
A 256x256 pixels PNG with transparent background is preferred. Do not use rectangular images. Stick to a square aspect ratio.
